div.pre: 1388 Bashköy, near Kapadüz, c. 20 km. S of Ordu (anc. Cotyora), Pontus, 1959? Burial: c. 65 B.C. (Pfeiler) Contents: 2003+ AE Amasia Amisus Cabeira Chabacta Comana Gaziura Amastris Pimolisa Sinope Disposition: Ankara 2003 (inv. no. 1485) Information from Saadet Taner The issues of Amisus are by far the most numerous, followed by those of Sinope and Amastris. The numbers of coins from the other mints are small (Ga- ziura 2; Pimolisa 1). It is possible that the lot in Ankara derives from the large hd. mentioned in JNG 1969, p. 79, as appearing already in 1947 at Ordu Information from P. Franke indicates that there should probably be added to this hd. a few AE from Pergamum, Rhodes, Side, Laodiceia ad Mare, and Seleuceia Pieria
